episodes.title: VHS BETTER quality ~ Scientology on 60 Mins ~ Re-Upload ~ 60 Minutes interview raw footage 1985
episodes.description:
I didn't expect so many people to take interest in the upload from behind the scenes of the contentious Mike Wallace interview with Heber Jentszch & Earle Cooley about scientology on June 6, 1985! But since it's getting clipped and shared and reacted to, I wanted to fix the audio as much as I could, and remove the flashing lights that occur when the picture drops out periodically. Hopefully this better version will be easier on the eyes and ears.

Enjoy my uploads? You might like my Twitch channel, where I watch all sorts of wacky found VHS tapes live at www.twitch.tv/vcarchives

episodes.title: VHS Compilation of news reports about Scientology lawsuits, 1985
episodes.description:
A few different news reports about the Julie Tichborne judgment being overturned in Portland, OR.
Julie Tichborne filed a suit against the church claiming fraud because she did not experience any improvements in her eyesight or intelligence like she was promised. After winning her suit, the judgement was overturned and Scientology partied in the streets.

episodes.title: VHS Scientology 60 Minutes interview raw footage - June 26, 1985
episodes.description:
Heber Jenzstch and Earle Cooley in an interview with Mike Wallace for 60 Minutes. The Church of Scientology brought their own cameras and a small audience to the interview, which Wallace is not thrilled about. It's an intimidation tactic the church commonly employed for press interviews. This tape is from one of the CoS cameras.
I can't even begin to summarize all of the material that is covered in this video. You'll just have to watch it for yourself. It features some top-notch spin, deflection, conspiracy theories, whataboutism, and masterful straw man arguments. Basically, a church is above the law and any criticism whatsoever is an attack on the first amendment and freedom. 
Heber really was good at his job. His rhetoric is frustrating and sometimes infuriating, especially when he compares attacks on the church to Nazi tactics (which he does a LOT... right in the face of a Jewish person, no less).
It does have spots of video and/or audio glitch, but if you just ride them out, they are brief.
Sadly, the tape ends and I don't have the rest of the interview.

Here is an upload I found of the final 60 Minutes piece, so you can see how they cut it together: https://youtu.be/eV-XvxQFADo?si=MA39RBtMrDQ_RdFI

I encourage folks to take these videos and spread them around, whole or in part-- I only ask 2 things: 1. throw me a link and a credit; 2. remind your viewers that Heber Jentzsch, who gave his life to the cult, has been disappeared and hasn't been seen by his family in many years #freeheber

episodes.title: VHS Scientology Press Conference about L Ron Hubbard's Death - Jan 29, 1986
episodes.description:
Note: the two men featured in this video have been disappeared by the church and their whereabouts are unknown.
On Jan 29, 1986, the Church of Scientology hosted this press conference about the death of their founder, L. Ron Hubbard, at the "LRH Museum". Featuring the following characters: President of Church of Scientology International Heber Jenztsch, Pres of CoS Los Angeles Ken Hoden, and a lawyer named Earle Cooley shouting over the phone.
Following a comedy of errors of trying to get the speaker phone to work, Heber launches into some fascinating conspiracy stuff about Ron DeWolf (Hubbard's estranged son) and his lawyer (not that) Michael Flynn -- who they say is funded by laundered Rockefeller dark money -- and the evil cabal of IRS operatives who want to destroy the first amendment. They are very angry and defensive from the start and Heber is quite snarky towards reporters asking relatively softball questions about Hubbard's will being changed, the wait of several days to announce his death, his cremation without autopsy, etc. (Spoiler: They say he was exempt from autopsy for religious reasons. There is nothing in Scientology that forbids autopsy, to the best of my knowledge .)
This press conference is loaded with inconsistencies. For example, they say Hubbard was up and walking around and working right until he died. But they say the death certificate indicates the stroke occurred a full week beforehand. They say he willingly dropped his body and one reporter very sensibly asks, "So did he WILL himself into having a stroke?"
Top to bottom, a fascinating tape -- from the huge old TV cameras to the 80s mustaches to Heber's visual aide, and of course the hot pile of nonsense that is the conference itself. ENJOY!

I encourage folks to take these videos and spread them around, whole or in part-- I only ask 2 things: 1. throw me a link and a credit; 2. remind your viewers that Heber Jentzsch, who gave his life to the cult, has been disappeared and hasn't been seen by his family in many years #freeheber

episodes.title: VHS Scientology Creston Ranch helicopter fly-over 1986 - Where L Ron Hubbard died
episodes.description:
I have a lot of questions about this short clip I found at the end of a tape. It is Scientology's Creston Ranch in San Luis Obispo. Did the ranch really look this crappy in 1986 when Hubbard died there? Compare it to more recent footage or google maps and it looks like a slum. This clip fascinates me! 
There are people I could ask about this but none of them knew where Hubbard was at that time, as he was in hiding and this location was a secret to all but a few. So I don't even think I could find someone to confirm or deny that this is how the ranch actually looked then. It hardly seems like a fitting place for such an important man to drop his body. 

I encourage folks to take these videos and spread them around, whole or in part-- I only ask for a link and a credit please :0)

episodes.title: VHS CNN 7-25-85 - Scientology v Titchbourne lawsuit, Portland OR - Heber Jentzsch, Pres. CoS
episodes.description:
Julie Tichbourne was a parishioner of the Church of Scientology in Portland in the 80s. She won a lawsuit for $39 mil after claiming she was defrauded. Then, in July of 1985, the ruling was overturned and scientologists partied in the streets. This piece is from CNN, featuring President of CoS Int'l Heber Jentzsch gloating and then showing us an amazing diagram of the true nature of mankind. (I don't think the diagram is to scale.)

Heber has been out of the public eye for 20 years. He is about to turn 88 years old. Some say he is in ill health and is not being well cared-for by the church he committed his life to. I encourage everyone to look into recent news and exposes about how scientology exploits and find out what you can do to help.

I encourage folks to take these videos and spread them around, whole or in part-- I only ask 2 things: 1. throw me a link and a credit; 2. remind your viewers that Heber Jentzsch, who gave his life to the cult, has been disappeared and hasn't been seen by his family in many years #freeheber

episodes.title: VHS Heber Jentzsch Pres. of Scientology appearance on "Late Night America" 7-26-85
episodes.description:
President of Church of Scientology Heber Jentzsch appeared on this late-night cable access show in 1985. For the second half of the broadcast, they take live calls from viewers. Also included is a clip of Ron DeWolf AKA L Ron Hubbard Jr. AKA "Nibs", speaking about how his father is a grifter. It's a fascinating look at a time when Scientology wasn't so afraid of critics and were willing to talk to the public.

Heber has been out of the public eye for 20 years. He is about to turn 88 years old. Some say he is in ill health and is not being well cared-for by the church he committed his life to.

I encourage folks to take these videos and spread them around, whole or in part-- I only ask 2 things: 1. throw me a link and a credit; 2. remind your viewers that Heber Jentzsch, who gave his life to the cult, has been disappeared and hasn't been seen by his family in many years #freeheber
